H3526.def: = action by which humans remove physical contamination from their bodies by dipping it in water, ≈ used figuratively to denote the removal of guilt

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H2891.def: = process by which an area or object becomes free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H905.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H2135.def: = state in which someone is considered as upright and innocent in character and behavior

H2342.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H2399.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H3179.def: = process by which female animals are in the physical state required to conceive offspring

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H2910.def: meaning unsure; possibly: =  the long-legged, wading bird sacred to ancient Egyptians ≈ symbol of the Egyptian god Thoth (note the similarity of spelling); thought able to announce flooding of the Nile.

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H231.def: = plant with a shrub-like base and stems which are erect, stiff and strong; it reaches a height of just under one meter; it may grow from the ground but also spring out of crevices in walls, cliffs and rocks; its leaves and branches are hairy, and its flowers white; ◄ origanum maru; ► the plant is aromatic, and the dried leaves are used as a condiments; the leaves and little branches, when collected in bunches, are suitable for sprinkling purposes, as the hairy surface holds the liquid; used in the ritual purification of the Jews

H2891.def: = process by which an area or object becomes free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H3526.def: = action by which humans remove physical contamination from their bodies by dipping it in water, ≈ used figuratively to denote the removal of guilt

H3835.def: literally: to become white; hence: = process by which branches become light in color because they are stripped of their bark

H7950.def: = frozen crystallized water vapor in the form of very white flakes which fall as precipitation from the sky and cover the ground during freezing cold weather; as soon as the temperature rises above freezing, it melts and becomes water; ≈ associated with cold, whiteness, or purity

H8342.def: poetic term; = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H8057.def: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H1794.def: literally: to crush; hence: = causative by which a deity inflicts deadly wounds on a individual or group ◄ as if crushing that person or those people with a heavy object

H1523.def: mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H2399.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

H4229.def: = causative action by which humans clean or dry an object or body part by rubbing it with a cloth or with their hands; sometimes extended to refer to God; ≈ sometimes associated with destruction

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H1254.def: = causative action by which humans cause something else to get its desired shape by cutting off certain parts of it

H2889.def: = state in which an object is free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2318.def: = causative action by which humans restore an object to make it function again in the way it has functioned before

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H8342.def: poetic term; = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H3468.def: = a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state

H5564.def: = action by which humans put their hand(s) on another human, an animal, or an object ► often as a ritual before sacrifice or a sign of authority or punishment

H5081.def: = state in which humans are willing to perform a certain task and show that by their actions

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3925.def: = process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

H6586.def: = action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H2400.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a specified or implied offence, ► which results in a state of guilt which may require atonement, restitution, and retribution

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H8668.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H2077.def: = the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and the other part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

H7521.def: = state in which an animal or its meat is acceptable to God as sacrifice

H2077.def: = the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and the other part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H1794.def: literally: to crush; hence: = causative by which a deity inflicts deadly wounds on a individual or group ◄ as if crushing that person or those people with a heavy object

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H959.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H7522.def: = state in which deities or humans in a position of authority are favorable disposed towards a person or activity

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H2077.def: = the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and the other part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

H3632.def: = state in which an object has been affected by an event in its entirety

H6499.def: = young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H4196.def: = construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

12.gl: to break (someone's) heart > to cause profound grief

8.gl: to break (someone's) spirit > to cause profound grief
